Free Shipping & Returns

Receive your new mattress right at your doorstep with our free shipping anywhere in the continental US. Return policies apply.

Quick & Easy Setup

The mattress can be used within a few minutes upon opening the package. Setup is just a few easy steps.

Forever Warranty

Icon Sleep's 10-Year Forever Warranty gives you specfic legal rights, and you may have other rights that may vary from state to state.

100 Night Risk-Free Trial

If after the 100-night sleep trial you're not satisfied with our mattress, you can return it to us and we will refund you the full amount you paid.

Nothing feels better than the weekend

The Weekender Hybrid is more than just a mattress – it’s an experience As always with Icon Sleep, this product is CertiPUR-US® and STANDARD 100 OEKO-TEX® certified.

Product Features

Zero Motion Transfer

Cushioning, quilted memory foam conforms to the body’s natural shape and helps reduce motion transfer for better and longer sleeps.

Powerful Pressure Relief

Layered, soft comfort foams help relieve pressure points and thick base layer encasement provides edge-to-edge support to the body.

Traditional Coil Architecture

Heavy-duty tempered coils create a strong mattress core, ensuring that all memory foam layers are intact and not compromised.

Up-close with the Icon:

A Weekend-er that doesn’t fall short.

Quilted memory foam conforms to the body and helps reduce motion transfer

Made using CertiPUR-US® certified foams and Oeko-TEX® certified textiles

Layered, soft comfort foams help relieve pressure points

Thick foam encasement provides edge-to-edge support

Heavy-duty tempered coils create a strong core

SLEEP WITHOUT INTERRUPTIONS

Eliminate your sleeping problems with the Weekender Hybrid’s Zero Motion Transfer technology that allows you to sleep longer without annoying breaks.

TOP-NOTCH COMFORT ALL NIGHT LONG

Experience pressure relief from body aches and pains with the Weekender Hybrid’s multi-layer architecture that provides excellent spinal support and extra comfort all night long.

LONG-LASTING MATTRESS

The Weekender Hybrid is designed to last for years thanks to its extremely durable memory foam layers and coils that help prevent mattress sagging in the long run.

Everybody loves the Weekend-er

Share with us your Hybrid experience!

Have questions?

Here are some frequently asked questions.

Can you flip a hybrid mattress?

No, the typical hybrid mattress has a top-down design, meaning you’re supposed to lay on one side of the bed, while the other is made to rest on a bed base. Flipping a top-down mattress like the Weekender Hybrid can wear the bed down drastically, and is just plain uncomfortable to lay on.

Read More

Do hybrid mattresses need a box spring?

No, the Weekender Hybrid doesn’t require a box spring. In fact, box springs may harm hybrid mattresses because they are not a suitable foundation for top-down beds. REMEMBER: pairing most hybrid mattresses with a box spring may void their warranties.

Read More

Do hybrid mattresses sag?

The Weekender Hybrid is made with heavy-duty tempered coils that create a strong core and a second line of defense against sagging.

Read More

components/common/responsive-img: {{!-- This file implements the lazysizes srcset pattern (as seen on https://github.com/aFarkas/lazysizes#modern-transparent-srcset-pattern) for maximum performance on modern browsers and reasonable compatibility with legacy browsers. There are a few important arguments to know about when using this component: `lazyload`: - If set to 'lazyload+lqip', will load a low-res image which will be replaced by lazysizes - ensuring that SOME content is shown immediately on page load. Without LQIP, a transparent gif will be used instead, which reduces the number of requests needed to load the page, making it even faster. - If set to 'lazyload', the browser will not load the full-size image at first, instead the lazysizes plugin will load it progressively after page load. This improves the load speed of the page, but it should be disabled for high-priority above-the-fold images. - If set to 'disabled', will not attempt to lazyload the image and instead tell the browser to load it immediately. Use this for high-priority images that are above the fold. `fallback_size`: This is the size to use for this image in legacy browsers that do not support srcset. Can be defined as a pixel bounding-box size (e.g. "123x123) or inherent width (e.g. "123w"). `class`: The CSS classes to add to the image, e.g. "card-image". If lazyloading is enabled, all images will have the "lazyload" class so that lazysizes will target them automatically. `otherAttributes`: Any other HTML attributes you want on the img tag, for example "height='100' width='100'" `default_image`: The default image to use if `image` is undefined or falsy. Should be a theme asset, usually defined as a relative path in the theme config. If a default image is not provided, you'll get an image tag with no image if the primary image is undefined. `lqip_size`: If you want to specify a particular size for the LQIP image, you can do so with this argument. A default of 80 pixels wide will be used otherwise. This argument has no effect if the lazyload mode is not "lazyload+lqip". --}}
